title: TEM Grid Surface Micropatterning Using Modified Graphene for In Situ Cell Imaging
content: Cryo-electron tomography (cryo-ET) stands at the forefront as a state-of-the-art tool, providing high-resolution insights into the natural cellular environment, events, and structures of diverse macromolecular complexes [1]. Nevertheless, the current tilt series acquisition method encounters challenges, such as misplacing the cell of interest outside suitable imaging areas on TEM grids [2]. Addressing this concern, the pre-patterning of the grid surface becomes indispensable for achieving efficient imaging.
